episode_title: 211 - The One With the Lesbian Wedding

content.description: at Ross’s. Carol and Susan are picking Ben up

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok. Here’s his diaper bag, and his uh, Mr. Winky, and uh…oh, him. Hi!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: So how did everything go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, great. Great. There was a projectile, uh, throwing up incident, but he started it.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Well, we’ve gotta go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: [clears her throat]

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Oh, right. Um, I’ve got some news. It’s about us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you and me?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Uh, no, Susan and me.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: The other us.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: We’re uh, we’re getting married.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: As in, “I now pronounce you wife and wife” married?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Anyway, we’d like you to come, but we totally understand if you don’t want to.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why wouldn’t I want to come? I had fun at the first wedding.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Look I just thought that…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no no, I mean, hey, why shouldn’t I be happy for you? What would it say about me if I couldn’t revel in your joy? I’m revelling baby, believe me!

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Is your finger caught in that chair?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mmm hmmm.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Want us to go?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is so cool. You’re actually gonna be on television.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It really hit me last night. I’m gonna be on Days of our Lives. And then I started thinkin’ about all of u, and how these are the days of our lives..

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Carol and Susan’s caterer had a mountain bike accident this weekend, and she’s in a full body cast.

content.speaker: Ross, Chandler & Joey
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They want me to do it, which is really cool, seeing as I’ve never catered before, and I really need the money, and this isn’t a problem for you, is it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Would it matter?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, you are so great! [kisses him] Thank you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you really not going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I am really not going. I don’t get it. They already live together, why do they need to get married?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They love each other, and they wanna celebrate that love with the people that are close with them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: If you wanna call that a reason.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [singing to the tune of Mister Rogers’ Neighborhood] Who’s the bitterest man in the living room, the bitterest man in the living room? Hi, neighbor.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, I thought you were over this.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, that has nothing to do with this, ok? She’s my ex-wife. If she were marrying a guy, none of you’d expect me to be there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, if she were marrying a guy, she’d be like the worst lesbian ever.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: [entering hurriedly] Did I miss it? Did I miss it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I’m on right after this guy shoots himself.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Whoa, she’s pretty.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, and she’s really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you’re thinkin’ of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, ok.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There’s my scene, there’s my scene. [Joey on tv] “Mrs. Wallace, I’m Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister’s neurosurgeon.

content.speaker: Mrs. Wallace
content.text: Is she gonna be all right?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..subcranial hematoma. Perhaps we can discuss this over coffee.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nice!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excellent!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: For a minute there I thought you were actually tryin’ to smell something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That is so good! Do it again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, all right. “Damnit Braverman, it’s right there on the chart!”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great. All right, I gotta get to work, I got a big dinosaur bone to inspect.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No no, that’s me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, hello.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, thanks. I couldn’t uh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is everything ok?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, no, huh-uh. One of my clients died on the massage table today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a little more relaxed than you want them to get.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, um, she was 82 years old. Her name was um, Mrs. Adelman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, honey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, it’s just so strange. I mean, she probably woke up today and thought, “ok, I’ll have some breakfast, and then I’ll take a little walk, and then I’ll have my massage.” Little did she know God was thinking, “Ok, but that’s it.” Oh, but the weirdest thing was, ok, I was cleansing her aura when she died, and when the spirit left her body, I don’t think it went very far.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you mean?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think it went into me.
[Everyone takes a step back from Phoebe]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: God, this is so hard. I can’t decide between lamb or duck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, of course, lambs are scarier. Otherwise the movie would’ve been called Silence of the Ducks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ok, who ordered what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I believe I had the half-drunk cappuccino with the lipstick on the rim.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and this with the cigarette butt in it, is that decaf?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh god.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe you’re so uptight about your mom comin’.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know, but it’s just it’s the first time, and I just don’t want her to think that because I didn’t marry Barry, that my life is total crap, you know?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [Mrs. Adelman’s voice] Talk about crap. Try listening to Stella Niedman tell the story of her and Rod Steiger for the hundredth time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, how long do you think this lady’ll be with us?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. I mean, she obviously has some kind of unfinished business. [Mrs. Adelman’s voice] Sit up!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: [entering] There she is.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mom!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Sweetie! So this is where you work? Oh, it’s wonderful! Is it a living room? Is it a restaurant? Who can tell? But I guess that’s the fun.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pretty much.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Monica! You look gorgeous! Last time I saw you, it was eat or be eaten.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: This is Joey, and Phoebe, and this is Chandler, and you remember Ross.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh hello, Ross.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi, Mrs. Green. [He gets up to shake her hand, but she ignores him.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: So, what do you think of my daughter in the apron with the big job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Mom!

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: If you didn’t pour the coffee, no one would have anything to drink.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Believe me, sometimes that happens.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: This is just so exciting. You know, I never worked. I went straight from my father’s house to the sorority house to my husband’s house. I am just so proud of you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know who it is you remind me of. Evelyn Dermer. ’Course, that’s before she got the lousy face lift. Now she looks like Soupy Sales.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, who’s Evelyn Dermer?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. Who’s Soupy Sales?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh my god, there’s an unattractive nude man playing the cello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, well just be glad he’s not playing a smaller instrument.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: [laughing] You have some life here, sweetie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know. And Mom, I realize you and Daddy were upset when I didn’t marry Barry and get the big house in the suburbs with all the security and everything, but this is just so much better for me, you know?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I do. You didn’t love Barry. And I’ve never seen you this happy. I look at you and I think, oh, this is what I want.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: For…me.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Well, not just for you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, what do you mean?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I’m uh, considering leaving your father.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [entering] All right. Tell me if this is too cute. Lesbian wedding, chicken breasts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh god. I think I’m gonna be sick.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? It’s not like I’m putting little nipples on them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And you had no idea they weren’t getting along?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: None.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They didn’t fight a lot?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! They didn’t even talk to each other. God, how was I supposed to know they were having problems?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [Mrs. Adelman’s voice] In my day, divorce was not an option.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, look who’s up.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I just can’t believe this is happening. I mean, when I was little, everybody’s parents were getting divorced. I just figured as a grownup I wouldn’t have to worry about this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is there any chance that you can look at this as flattering? I mean, she’s doing it because she wants to be more like you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then, you know, couldn’t she have just copied my haircut?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, it’s funny when my parents got divorced, they sent me to this shrink, and she told me that all kids have a tendency to blame themselves. But in your case it’s actually kinda true.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s him.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Damn. My mail order grandfather hasn’t come yet.

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, hi, Mr. Adelman. Thanks for meeting me.

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Oh, that’s all right, although you did cut into my busy day of sitting.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Um, do you wanna sit?

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Oh, no, please, I spent most of mid-morning trying to stand up. Now uh, what can I do for you, my dear?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know how to say this, but I think when your wife’s spirit left her body, it um, kind of stuck around in me.

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: You’re saying, my wife is in you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Ok, you don’t have to believe me but um, can you think of any unfinished business she might have had, like any reason she’d be hanging around?

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Well, I don’t know what to tell you dear. The only thing I can think of is that she always used to say that before she died, she wanted to see everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Everything?

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Everything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa, that’s a lot of stuff.

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: Oh, wait, I remember, she also said she wanted to sleep with me one last time.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m sorry, there’s laughing in my head.

content.speaker: Mr. A
content.text: [to Joey] Worth a shot, huh?
[Joey nods and shrugs.]

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Look at this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: These are from Halloween three years ago.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, look, here’s Barry. Did he have to come straight from the office?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, that was his costume. See, he’s actually an orthodontist, but he came as a regular dentist.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um, you guys, you know when I said before, “thank you, but I don’t really need your help”?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Actually, what I think you said was, “don’t touch that, and get the hell out of my kitchen.”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really? Weird. Anyway, see, I planned everything really well. I planned and I planned and I planned. It just turns out, I don’t think I planned enough time to actually do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Mon, you want some help?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: If you want.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [enters] Hey. What a day. I took her everywhere. The Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Center, Statue of Liberty.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’s still with you?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. I guess she hasn’t seen everything yet. I’ll be right back, she has to go to the bathroom again. [Takes Mrs. Green’s chin in her hand and says, in Mrs. Adelman’s voice] Oh, such a pretty face.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: This is so much fun, just the girls. You know what we should do? Does anybody have any marijuana?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, look, nobody’s smoking pot around all this food.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: That’s fine. I never did it. I just thought I might. So, what’s new in sex?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! What’s new in sex?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: The only man I’ve ever been with is your father.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m dicing, I’m dicing, I don’t hear anything.

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I mean, this is no offense to your dad, sweetie, but I was thinking there might be more.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I’m sorry. You know what? I cannot have this conversation with you. I mean, god, you just come in here, and drop this bomb on me, before you even tell Daddy. What? What do you want? Do you want my blessing?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You want me to talk you out of it?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Then what? What do you want?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: I guess I just figured of all people you would understand this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why on earth would I understand this?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: You didn’t marry your Barry. I did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right people, we’re in trouble here. We’ve only got 12 hours and 36 minutes left. Move, move, move!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica, I feel like you should have German subtitles.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Joey, speed it up!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m sorry, it’s the pigs. they’re reluctant to get in the blankets!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, how did this happen? I thought you had this all planned out.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want me to cry? Is that what you want? Do you wanna see me cry?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sir! No sir!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: [to Ross] All right, you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. Look, I told you I am not a part of this thing.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, look, Ross. I realize that you have issues with Carol and Susan, and I feel for you, I do. But if you don’t help me cook, I’m gonna take a bunch of those little hot dogs, and I’m gonna create a new appetizer called “pigs in Ross”. All right, ball the melon.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey! How come I’m stuck dicing, when he gets to ball the melon.
[knock at the door]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: How’s it going?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s goin’ great. Right on schedule. Got my little happy helpers. [everyone groans]

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Fine, whatever.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Nothing. Ok, everything. I think we’re calling off the wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re still gonna pay me, right? Or something a little less selfish.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Carol, what’s the matter? What happened?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: My parents called this afternoon to say they weren’t coming.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: I mean, I knew they were having trouble with this whole thing, but they’re my parents. They’re supposed to give me away and everything.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s ok. I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: And then Susan and I got in this big fight because I said maybe we should call off the wedding, and she said we weren’t doing it for them, we were doing it for us, and if I couldn’t see that, then maybe we should call off the wedding. I don’t know what to do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I uh can’t believe I’m gonna say this, but I think Susan’s right.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, do you love her? And you don’t have to be too emphatic about this.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Of course I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well then that’s it. And if George and Adelaide can’t accept that, then the hell with them. Look, if my parents didn’t want me to marry you, no way that would have stopped me. Look, this is your wedding. Do it.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: You’re right. Of course you’re right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So we’re back on?

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: We’re back on.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You heard the woman. Peel, chop, devil! I can’t believe I lost 2 minutes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It just seems so futile, you know ? All these women, and nothing. I feel like Superman without my powers, you know? I have the cape, and yet I cannot fly.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well now you understand how I feel every single day, ok? The world is my lesbian wedding.
[Wedding music starts, Phoebe noisily unwraps a piece of candy.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [Mrs. Adelman’s voice] Butterscotch? No one? All right, you’ll be sorry later.
[Monica pushes Ben down the aisle in a stroller. Susan is escorted by both her parents. Carol is escorted by Ross.]

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Any time. [He doesn’t want to let her go]

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Ross. [He lets her go]

content.speaker: Minister
content.text: You know, nothing makes God happier than when two people, any two people, come together in love. Friends, family, we’re gathered here today to join Carol and Susan in holy matrimony.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: [Mrs. Adelman’s voice] Oh my god. Now I’ve seen everything! [Phoebe’s voice] Whoa, she’s gone. She’s gone. She’s gone! Go ahead, get married. Go, go.
[At the reception, Monica and Ross watch Carol and Susan getting their picture taken.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you look at them?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, can’t help but.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [to a wedding guest] How’s that pig-in-the-blanket workin’ out for you? [the guy nods] I wrapped those bad boys.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I miss Rose.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, yeah?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I know it’s kind of weird, but I mean, she was a big part of my life there, you know, and now I just feel kind of alone.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: You know, I uh, I couldn’t help but overhear what you just said, and I think it’s time for you to forget about Rose, move on with your life…how ‘bout we go get you a drink?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ok, that’s so nice.
[Chandler tries to warn Phoebe that the woman is coming on to her, but Phoebe doesn’t see him.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to an attractive woman] I shouldn’t even bother coming up with a line, right? [The woman walks away]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Mom? Having fun?

content.speaker: Mrs. Green
content.text: Oh, am I! I just danced with a wonderfully large woman. And three other girls made eyes at me over the buffet. Oh, I’m not saying it’s something I wanna pursue, but it’s nice to know I have options.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: There’s more alcohol, right?
[Susan approaches Ross, who’s looking lonely]

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: How you doin’?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You did a good thing today.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: You wanna dance?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, that’s fine.

content.speaker: Susan
content.text: Come on. I’ll let you lead.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ok.
[They dance; Carol looks on lovingly.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: [to the woman who just rejected him] All right look. Penis schmenis. We’re all people. [She walks away again.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ok, which one of us do you think is gonna be the first one to get married?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, Mon, I was married.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, me, too, technically.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I had a wedding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, just trying to start an interesting discussion.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I got one. Which one of us do you think will be the last to get married? [They all look at Chandler]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Isn’t Ben in this?

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh, yeah!
